result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven Thomas Robinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Fine of $1,200.00, DNA surcharge, all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges.  .  All to be paid through colection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Doc shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.

superMiscConds.notes: Comply with the standard rules of Extended supervision.
Coperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Submit to random urine screens.
Not to operate any motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.

supervisions.notes: Cpurt Order for IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan signed and filed.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Provide DNA sample, pay surcharge.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Steven Thomas Robinson in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Steven Thomas Robinson in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Statements made by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to the Wisconsin State Prison for a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 42 MONTHS, with credit for ZERO days time served.  
Court ordered 18 MONTHS for the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT and 24 MONTHS of EXTENDED SUPERVISION.

Court finds the defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds the defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
* Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* Provide DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge.  The Court ordered that the DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.  The Court ordered that the court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY fine in the amount of $1,200.00.  The Court ordered that the fine be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Court ordered a 2 year revocation of defendant's driver's license.  Reinstatement fee to apply.
* Defendant is not to operate any motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
* Any vehicle titled in the defendant's name or driven by the defendant is to have an ignition interlock device installed for 2 years.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Defendant's Blood Toxicology Report.
Court Order for IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan.

Defendant Steven Thomas Robinson in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Steven Thomas Robinson in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form tendered to the Court.

AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY "as charged". Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.

Attorney Anne A Devitt in court, defendant Steven Thomas Robinson not in court, in custody.  Catelin A Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense just received State's offer today.
Defense requests another scheduling conference date for time to review State's offer with the defendant.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 07-15-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Scheduling Conference.
Original Transcript (12 pages) commencing on 05-07-2014 PRELIMINARY HEARING received and filed.

Defendant Steven Thomas Robinson in court with Imran Kurter, student intern under the supervision of attorney Anne A Devitt.  Defendant Steven Thomas Robinson in custody.  Catelin A Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Stipulation to the Defendant being convicted of (3) previous OPERATING WHILE INTOXICATED is agreed upon by the parties and approved by the court.
Sworn for the state:David Pasdera-West Allis Police Department Sargeant.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by portable breathalyzers and SCRAM.

Defendant Steven Thomas Robinson in court with attorney Matthew A Lamke.  Defendant Steven Thomas Robinson in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 7, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
